items.title: Vedanta asked to pay 'environmental compensation', plans legal recourse against Odisha pollution body's order
items.description: The order on compensation will be contested by the company after assessing the matter and examining the veracity, Vedanta said in its statement.

items.title: AI ‘application’ start-ups become big businesses in new tech race
items.description: Companies building consumer products on top of LLMs are growing fast and attracting investor interest

items.title: GMR Power hives off stressed assets to deleverage balance sheet by Rs 4,400 crore
items.description: GMR Energy (GEL) and GMR Generation Assets (GGAL) - subsidiaries of the GMR Power - have agreed on a framework with Synergy Investments Holding to divest their respective stakes

items.title: TCS CEO Krithivasan expects tariff 'uncertainty' to be 'resolved soon': Report
items.description: The CEO says a $50-billion revenue target by 2030 is still a 'possibility'

items.title: NTPC begins getting coal delivered directly at plants, private miners get bigger play
items.description: NTPC’s new fuel sourcing strategy is a shift to a more market-driven approach and could be emulated by state and private companies to mitigate risks of supply chain disruptions

items.title: Pfizer abandons obesity pill after liver injury in major setback
items.description: The news will intensify pressure on Pfizer Chief Executive Officer Albert Bourla, who has repeatedly pointed to the drugmaker’s pipeline as an undervalued source of future growth.

items.title: Centre's draft rules for gas meters propose mandatory testing, verification and stamping
items.description: The objective of the draft rules, issued by the Department of Consumer Affairs, is to bring in reliability and transparency in the measurement of gas. The proposed regulations also have a provision of re-verification to ensure their correctness once these are in use.

items.title: Steel major AM/NS India gets import exemption for key raw material despite curbs
items.description: The JV unit of the world's largest steelmaker had earlier sought relief against the rejection of 168,300 mt of met coke import orders from Indonesia and Poland.
